column4: hi, please someone help me,,,  i once installed ubuntu 10.4 but lost pass, so from windows 7 i deleted the ubuntu partition,,, now ive made a ubuntu 12.04 64 bit usb boot, and when i boot ubuntu from usb i get login prompt and password,,, i tried ubuntu as login and blank pass but i only get black screen for 0.5 ms and then login again
someone who know the anwser?\
those two cannot be related. If it's the live version intalled to USB it would have nothing to do with your previous installation.
I'm not entirely sure. Are you positive you deleted those partitions?
if you need to delete the partitions they should be in your Disk Management
If I were you I would go into BIOS. DISABLE every boot device except your USB drive.
and then boot from the usb drive. If every other drive is disabled we can eliminate your past install from the equation.
yes. But make sure they are disabled in bios. Not just lower on the list of boot devices. Does this make sense?
are you asking how do you disable boot devices?
You find the option in BIOS?
something like that. It depends on your PC maker. But yes, look around. You should be able to find a list of "CD-ROM" "HDD" "USB" something like that.
you have them disabled. All except the usb drive?
alright.  we know then that the usb drive has a password on it for some reason.
can you re-make the usb drive?
depends on your hardware.
if you are not for sure stick with 32bit. It will work no matter what.
then you should be fine to select 64bit. 32bit will work on a 64bit processor, just not the other way around.
be right back :)
cool. let me know how it goes.
i have mad usb
what?
ah good.
sorry that didn't work. I have no idea how this is happening to you if you have all other drives disabled.
so you didn't use the one I sent you a link to?
